intro: Prestoniopsis venosa, commonly known as the veined prestoniopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with prominent veins and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
